intro: Gouania glabra, commonly known as the smooth gouania, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually pink or white in color.
